Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Enterocin EJ97 (EntEJ97, natural AMPs; class 2d bacteriocins; leaderless, i.e. no signal peptide, Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes; BBrcp)

Literature Information.Literature: Enterocin EJ97 is active on several gram-positive bacteria including enterococci, several species of Bacillus, Listeria, and S. aureus. Enterocin EJ97 from Enterococcus faecalis EJ97 showed a concentration-dependent antimicrobial activity against L. monocytogenes CECT 4032. EntEJ97 showed the broadest activity spectrum, inhibiting E. faecium, E. faecalis, L.lactis, S. aureus, L. garvieae, and L. monocytogenes (Ovchinnikov KV et al., 2017).  Updated 10/2017.
Literature Information.Author: Gálvez A, Valdivia E, Abriouel H, Camafeita E, Mendez E, Martínez-Bueno M, Maqueda M.1998
Literature Information.Title: Isolation and characterization of enterocin EJ97, a bacteriocin produced by Enterococcus faecalis EJ97.
